boat.name: Rosie
boat.full_description:
2018 Sailed from Portland Dorset to Titchmarsh Marina, Walton on the Naze in October  taking 5 days.
First thing to fix was replace the Loo. Managed to find a brand new unused Blake’s Baby loo on eBay . It took 1 1/2 days to fit including new pipes. Also need to fit the new Blake’s sea cocks when ashore.
As it’s cold aboard a new Eberspacher heater was next.
The engine has been the most problematic item so far to fix. As Rosie wasn’t use for 18 years condensation inside the engine caused all the valve seats to corrode and lessen the compression ratios. So a full cylinder head rebuild later and I think it should be ok.havent had the time yet to do a proper sea trial. Have to wait until the new year now.
Bought new Chartplotter and have to fix it in place. Thinking of using a TV swinging mount attached to the access door frame as it’s a large 12” screen.
Need to fit an AIS transponder but will wait a couple of months hoping technology moved on as would like it integrated into the VHF radio with Splitter, GPS,AIS transponder,NMEA 2000. At the moment it doesn’t exist.
Jobs to do.
Make the bowsprit swivel.
Maybe lead lines aft into cockpit
Fit fresh water tank and pipes 
Feathering prop
boat.short_description: Rosie, ex Rosie G is a Cornish Crabbers Pilot Cutter built in 1990.
